solution.text: The First Law of Thermodynamics applies to the internal energy of an isolated system and states that the energy of the system is constant or \(\Delta U = q + w\).

content.text: The First Law of Thermodynamics can be represented by \(\Delta U = q + w\). Which of the following statements accurately describe the law?

incorrect.text: The energy of an isolated system varies with respect to external work
The energy of an closed system is constant if q = 0
The energy of a open system is only dependent on the value of w and q

correct.text: The energy of an isolated system is constant and \(\Delta U = 0\)
